trial_identification.studytitle: A Study to Collect Survival Data on Patients Previously Enrolled in Abraxane Pancreatic Cancer Study CA046.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: MPACT Extension Study: Multicenter, Survival Data Collection in Subjects Previously Enrolled in Protocol CA046

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: drugs - ABI-007
Patients previously enrolled in study CA046 - No intervention is being given in this extension study which is gathering survival information on participants of study NCT 00844649 (Celgene study CA046) who were known to be alive as of March 2013)
Treatment: drugs: ABI-007 No intervention is being given in this extension study which is gathering survival information on participants of study NCT 00844649 (Celgene study CA046) who were known to be alive as of March 2013)

primaryOutcome.outcome: Overall Survival - Number of participants who survive

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Disease progression - Date of disease progression and subsequent anticancer therapy for pancreatic adenocarcinoma other than that already recorded for subject while enrolled in CA046

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: - Must have been enrolled in the CA046 study Must have been living at the time of the last survival follow-up (approximate timeframe - end of March, 2013) Must understand and be able to give informed consent (if a subject is deceased, proper legal consent (ie, next of kin, legal representative) will be obtained prior to collection of data)

recruitment.hospital: HOCA - the Wesley Clinic for Heamatology and Oncology - Auchenflower

ethicsAndSummary.summary: A study to collect survival data on patients previously enrolled in Abraxane pancreatic cancer study CA046.
ethicsAndSummary.publication: Ramanathan RK, Goldstein D, Korn RL, Arena F, Moore M, Siena S, Teixeira L, Tabernero J, Van Laethem JL, Liu H, McGovern D, Lu B, Von Hoff DD. Development of peripheral neuropathy and its association with survival during treatment with nab-paclitaxel plus gemcitabine for patients with metastatic adenocarcinoma of the pancreas: A subset analysis from a randomised phase III trial (MPACT). Eur J Cancer. 2016 Jan;52:85-91. doi: 10.1016/j.ejca.2015.10.017. Epub 2015 Dec 1.
